Notes: On March 9, 2022, Gabon announced the lifting of the main measures taken to curb the COVID-19 pandemic.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/

On March 9, 2022, Gabon announced the lifting of the main measures taken to curb the COVID-19 pandemic.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/

The Government of Gabon lifted all Covid-19 restrictions of March 9, 2022, including "end of the limitation on the number of people participating in ceremonies and gatherings;" and "end of the ban on the practice of cultural activities and collective sports."    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523212200/https://infocovid.ga/retour-sur-les-meures-restrictives-levees/

The Government of Gabon lifted all Covid-19 restrictions of March 9, 2022, including "end of the limitation on the number of people participating in ceremonies and gatherings.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523212200/https://infocovid.ga/retour-sur-les-meures-restrictives-levees/
Public transportation is operating.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/
There is no curfew in place    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/
There is no restriction on interstate and intercity travel.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/
There is no health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/
No income support
No debt or contract relief.

There is a dedicated facebook page, #Info Covid19 GABON, that posts reminders about the virus and the need to get vaccinated for the people to be aware.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503093150/https://www.facebook.com/Covid19GOUVGA/?_rdc=2&_rdr

COVID-19 PCR tests are free of charge for in-country travel, and it takes two to three days to receive a result.  It is 20,000 FCFA for same day results and testing for international travel; these costs are covered by the individual requesting the testing.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/

On March 9, 2022, Gabon announced the lifting of the main measures taken to curb the COVID-19 pandemic.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/

The decree ending the compulsory wearing of masks in public places for the prevention and fight against COVID-19.    This decree, taken in application of the provisions of Law No. 003/2020 of May 11, 2020 setting the measures for the prevention, fight and response to health disasters, aims to put an end to the compulsory wearing of masks in all public spaces.    However, in view of the particular nature of the COVID-19 pandemic, the Council of Ministers recalls that wearing a mask remains strongly recommended in enclosed spaces and that compliance with the vaccination schedule prescribed by the health authorities is essential.    Wearing a mask strongly recommended in closed spaces and public transport. The decree also mark the end of the obligation to wear a mask and gloves and the systematic possession of disinfectant products by the driver.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220503094830/https://presidence.ga/4624-2/

The government of Gabon has provided vaccine for all eligible persons with the availability of Sinopharm and pfizer vaccine.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220523211844/https://ga.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/coronavirus-update/
No new policy update    https://web.archive.org/web/20220503094830/https://presidence.ga/4624-2/

All travelers older than 2 must be fully vaccinated or present a negative covid PCR test on arrival (if unvaccinated). The test must not be older than 3 days (this was reduced from 5 to 3 days on 29/3/2022). Vaccination certificates are only accepted from foreigners arriving from countries that also recognize Senegal's covid vaccine certificate. https://archive.ph/3mR0k  https://archive.vn/GLvJd https://web.archive.org/web/20220502220408/https://sn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Workplaces remain open with increased requirements for masking, social distancing and sanitation. From April 13th, 2022, all passengers travelling to Sierra Leone do not have to take a predeparture covid test. Vaccinated passengers must present proof of vaccination on arrival while unvaccinated passengers take both a rapid diagnostic test (RDT) and a covid PCR test on arrival, and are only quarantined if they test positive (RDT).     https://web.archive.org/web/20220516184224/http://dhse.gov.sl/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Public-Notice-Revised-travel-regulations09April2022.pdf       https://web.archive.org/web/20220516190502/https://www.dfa.ie/travel/travel-advice/a-z-list-of-countries/sierra-leone/

ClickÂ hereÂ for details.Â   ï·Visitors and crew entering Seychelles by sea must apply for health travel authorization via emailÂ pha@health.gov.sc.Â   ï·Visitors are required to adhere to all health protocols in place at their respective tourism accommodation/liveaboards including wearing of facemasks in common areas.  ï·Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 may be subject to 10 days of strict hospital or hotel room isolation, which may prevent or delay departure.  ï·Is a negative COVID-19 test (PCR and/or serology) required for entry?Â Yes, for not fully or unvaccinated visitors  ï·Are health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry?Â YesÂ   ï·Individuals seeking extensions of visa status or residency must contact theÂ Seychelles Immigration and Civil Status Office.    http://web.archive.org/web/20220531012036/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/

Tests are conducted in the Public Health Lab of the Seychelles Hospital and in private clinics.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220509083931/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/

A QR code-based application allows users to keep a private log of the places they visit and individuals they meet on their phone. Accurate information of their movements can then be shared with the Contact Tracing team in the Public Health Authority (PHA) if they test positive for the COVID-19 virus.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220425172052/http://www.health.gov.sc/index.php/2021/04/16/health-authority-encourages-download-of-new-contact-tracing-app-to-help-in-response-to-covid-19/

The wearing of masks in public places remains mandatory.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220509085758/http://www.seychellesnewsagency.com/articles/16377/Seychelles+relaxes+COVID+measures%2C+lifting+curfews%2C+closing+times%2C+allowing+family+meet-ups
Sinopharm, Astra Zeneca Covishield, Sputnik and Pfizer vaccines are available.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220509083931/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/
No additional recommendations beyond those applicable to the general public. https://web.archive.org/web/20220509083931/https://mu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-seychelles/
